snippet: Mrs. Stockdale became a spokeswoman for the families of Americans missing in action after getting coded notes from her husband, a Navy flier, revealing his torture in a North Vietnamese prison.
abstract: Sybil Stockdale, whose advocacy on behalf of American prisoners of war resulted in formation of organization now know as National League of P.O.W./M.I.A. Families, dies at age 90; her fervent advocacy for American prisoners of war began with capture of her husband, Vice Adm James B Stockdale, by North Vietnamese in 1965 when he was a captain.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Stockdale became a spokeswoman for the families of Americans missing in action after getting coded notes from her husband, a Navy flier, revealing his torture in a North Vietnamese prison.

headline.print_headline: Sybil Stockdale, Advocate for P.O.W.s Held in Vietnam War, Is Dead at 90
headline.main: Sybil Stockdale, Fierce Advocate for P.O.W.s and Their Families, Dies at 90
